head.title: Common Dysfunctions of the Integumentary System

body.p: Skin cancer – Cancers are most common in epithelial tissues because of several issues: stem cells in stratum basale have high mitotic rates like all epithelia; cells are most vulnerable to DNA damage during mitosis. Also, epidermal epithelial cells are exposed to UV radiation and other environmental factors since they interface with the environment.
Burns – The skin acts as a barrier to the environment. Thermal, chemical and radiation burn traumas that destroy the skin tissue often lead to infections because of the loss of barrier function.
Bedsores – Also called decubitis ulcers, these sores develop when regions of the skin start dying because constant pressure limits blood flow to that region of the skin.

Psoriasis and acne – There are many skin conditions which are caused by a dysfunction of normal integumentary processes. The overproduction of skin cells resulting in psoriasis and acne is caused by an infected or clogged sebaceous gland.

Calluses and scars – Like many systems of the body, the integumentary system is able to adapt to its external environment; calluses are thickened skin which accumulates in areas of continued mechanical abrasion; scars are caused by excess fibrous tissue being deposited when repairs are made to cuts in the skin
We will cover these conditions and more as we discuss normal function of the integumentary system.
